etymology.description: phonetic 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "ghost") + semantic 斗(斗) (dǒu, "ladle") -> soup ladle -> "leader"
etymology.interpretation: The character 魁(魁) combines 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "ghost") as the phonetic component with 斗(斗) (dǒu, "ladle") as the semantic component. Originally representing a large soup ladle, it evolved to mean "leader" due to associations with a prominent or significant position.

examples.chinese: 他被誉为乐队的魁(他被譽為樂隊的魁)，深受大众敬仰(深受大眾敬仰)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi yù wéi yuèduì de kuí, shēn shòu dàzhòng jìngyǎng.
examples.english: He is hailed as the leader of the band and is deeply admired by the public.

examples.chinese: 学校选举时(學校選舉時)，他理所当然当上了魁(他理所當然當上了魁)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào xuǎnjǔ shí, tā lǐsuǒdāngrán dāng shàng le kuí.
examples.english: During the school election, he naturally became the leader.
